item.title: Golang: ExpressionError
item.description:
Description

The ExpressionException class defines an exception that can be thrown by ExpressionCalculator.

Constructors

NewExpressionError

Exception that can be thrown by Expression Calculator.

NewExpressionError(correlationId, code, message string, line, column int) *ApplicationError

  • correlationId: string - transaction id used to trace execution through the call chain.
  • code: string - code
  • message: string - human-readable error message.
  • line: int - line number
  • column: int - column number

item.title: Golang: SyntaxError
item.description:
Description

The SyntaxException class defines the exceptions that can be thrown by the ExpressionParser class.

Constructors

NewSyntaxError

Exception that can be thrown by Expression Parser.

NewSyntaxError(correlationId, code, message string, line, column int) *ApplicationError

  • correlationId: string - transaction id used to trace execution through the call chain.
  • code: string - code
  • message: string - human-readable error message.
  • line: int - line number
  • column: int - column number

item.title: Golang: SyntaxErrorCode
item.description:
Description

The SyntaxErrorCode class defines general syntax errors.

Enumeration members

The codes are as follows:

The unknown

  • ErrUnknown = “UNKNOWN” The internal error
  • ErrInternal = “INTERNAL” The unexpected end.
  • ErrUnexpectedEnd = “UNEXPECTED_END” The error near
  • ErrErrorNear = “ERROR_NEAR” The error at
  • ErrErrorAt = “ERROR_AT” The unknown symbol
  • ErrUnknownSymbol = “UNKNOWN_SYMBOL” The missed close parenthesis
  • ErrMissedCloseParenthesis = “MISSED_CLOSE_PARENTHESIS” The missed close square bracket
  • ErrMissedCloseSquareBracket = “MISSED_CLOSE_SQUARE_BRACKET”
